profile.title: Profile
profile.text:
For more than ten years I have been dedicated to the development of software and management applications. I started programming in Delphi and J2EE and I am currently focusing my attention on web-oriented technologies, such as HTML5, CSS3, jQuery, PHP, Linux and MySQL. Nowadays I develop applications in Angular and TypeScript, an ideal combination to create user interfaces. You can find out more about my work in my personal GitHub account:

github.com/gchumillas

If you want to request more information you can send me an email to {{email}}. I will get in touch with you as soon as possible.

photoManager.title: Online photo manager
photoManager.text:
I'm a photography enthusiast so I decided to create a personal project to organize my pictures. It is a "first mobile" application mainly developed in Angular, TypeScript, PHP and MySQL. It uses Dropbox as image storage system. You can find more about this project in GitHub:

github.com/gchumillas/petitphotobox

cms.title: Content Management System
cms.text:
This application was born from the need of creating an "Universal Content Manager System". It is a highly configurable application capable of managing the content of any website, no matter how it was developed. The application was mainly developed in jQuery, PHP and MySQL. Here's a demo:

gchumillas.com/cms

howWorks.title: How does it work?
howWorks.text: The software development process is divided into several stages, and maintaining a constant contact with the client is crucial to ensure an adequate direction.

requirements.title: Compilation of requirements
requirements.text: During this first stage the communication begins. It pretends to establish the purpose as well as the requirements of the application. We can use Skype, email or other software to start conversations.

design.title: Templates design
design.text: Before starting the development stage it's very important to determine which screens will conform the application and their interaction between them. To achieve this a set of templates will be designed, subject to the client approval.

development.title: Development
development.text: Once the client has agreed the design we will start the development stage. It basically consists in "bringing to reality" the templates designed in the previous stage. Advances will be published regularly, so that the client can see the progress of the application.

installation.title: Delivering and installation
installation.text: Finally the application is delivered and installed on the client's server. I can provide a server in case the client does not have one.

howMuch.title: How much does it cost?
howMuch.text:
My current rate is 45â‚¬ per hour and each development stage is billed and paid independently. As an illustrative example let's say that we have a blog and we want to manage their entries. The application must be able to list, delete, edit or insert entries. In total there are four screens, including the log-in screen.

I would like to note that the following cost breakdown is illustrative only. Each application has its own peculiarities. But it seemed to me appropriate to illustrate with an example how much a simple application would cost.
